guidelines:
Materials:
Part 1:
Black 96-well microtiter plate
Pipet
25% glutaraldehyde
Liquid nitrogen

Part II:
None

Part III:
108 cell hosts & 107 phages for one-step
~240 ml host for plating
70 ml SN media
950 ml of SN top agar
480 ml of SN bottom agar
Water bath
Vortex
Micropipettes and tips
Electric pipette
66 --> 1 ml serological pipettes
1 --> 1L tissue culture flask
231 --> 15 ml snap cap tubes
230 --> SN bottom agar plates (60x15mm)
33 --> 1 ml luer-lock syringes
33 --> 0.2 µm syringe filters (25mm diameter)
10 --> 50 ml conical tubes
290 --> 1.5 µl centrifuge tubes


Phage Growth Parameters:


Phage(s) Morphology Burst Size Latent Period Host Citation
Syn5 podovirus 20-30 1 hr WH8109 Raytcheva et al. (2010)
S-CBP1, S-CBP2, S-CBP3 podovirus 75-92     Wang (2007)
P60 podovirus 81 1 hr WH7803 Brown et al (2006)
P-SSP7 podovirus   8 hrs Med4 Lindell et al (2007)
S-PM2* myovirus 21 9 hrs WH7803 Wilson et al (1996)
S-CAM4 myovirus ~50   WH7803 Kuznetsov et al (2010)
S-TIM5 myovirus ~35 6 hrs WH8102 Sabehi et al (2012)
S-CBM2 myovirus 28   CB0101 Wang (2007)
S-RIM1 myovirus 63 6 hrs WH7803 Stoddard et al (2007)
S-RIM8 myovirus 86 8 hrs WH7803 Stoddard et al (2007)
S-CBS2, S-CBS3, S-CBS3 siphovirus 57-175 > podoviridae
latent periods		 CB0204, CB0202, CB0101 Wang (2007)
S-BB1 siphovirus 250 Synechococcus strain Mann (2003)
*under phosphate limitation burst size is reduced by 80% and latent period is increased (Wilson et al. 1996)
NOTE: Estimates of burst sizes based on balancing estimates of viral decay and Synechococcus contacts yielded values ranging from 93 to 324 (Mann 2003)

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 2 of One-Step Growth Curves for Cyanophages
source_data.annotation: Make sure the 96-well microtiter plate you are using is clean inside and out, with no scratches or spots on its surface, as it will interfere with the light reading.
source_data.thread_text: Make sure the 96-well microtiter plate you are using is clean inside and out, with no scratches or spots on its surface, as it will interfere with the light reading.
source_data.body: Make sure the 96-well microtiter plate you are using is clean inside and out, with no scratches or spots on its surface, as it will interfere with the light reading.

source_data.protocol_name: Time 0 growth reading using a plate reader
source_data.protocol_name_html: Time 0 growth reading using a plate reader
source_data.description: For use in "One-step growth curve for Cyanophage"

versions.protocol_name: Time 0 growth reading using a plate reader
versions.protocol_name_html: Time 0 growth reading using a plate reader

components.data: Pipet 200 µl of the media you are growing the cell in (eg. SN media or Pro99 media) into wells A1 and A2 of a black 96-well microtiter plate.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pipet 200 µl of the media you are growing the cell in (eg. SN media or Pro99 media) into wells A1 and A2 of a black 96-well microtiter plate.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 1 of Time 0 growth reading using a plate reader
source_data.protocol_name: Time 0 growth reading using a plate reader
source_data.protocol_name_html: Time 0 growth reading using a plate reader

components.data: Pipet 200 µl of sample (the new culture you just inoculated) into wells B1 and B2 of the same plate.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pipet 200 µl of sample (the new culture you just inoculated) into wells B1 and B2 of the same plate.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 2 of Time 0 growth reading using a plate reader
source_data.protocol_name: Time 0 growth reading using a plate reader
source_data.protocol_name_html: Time 0 growth reading using a plate reader
source_data.annotation: Ensure that there are no bubbles in the wells, as they will affect your readings. Pipet away any bubbles.
source_data.thread_text: Ensure that there are no bubbles in the wells, as they will affect your readings. Pipet away any bubbles.
source_data.body: Ensure that there are no bubbles in the wells, as they will affect your readings. Pipet away any bubbles.

components.data: Read the plate on the plate reader without the lid.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Read the plate on the plate reader without the lid.

components.data: Continue taking readings in this way at approximately the same time every day for 21 days. Graph the results as you go and determine when exponential growth occurs!
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Continue taking readings in this way at approximately the same time every day for 21 days. Graph the results as you go and determine when exponential growth occurs!

components.data: Part I: Determine when the host is growing exponentially
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Part I: Determine when the host is growing exponentially

components.data: Repeat 2 more times to ensure the host growth is consistent.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Repeat 2 more times to ensure the host growth is consistent.

components.data: Part I: Determine when the host is growing exponentially
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Part I: Determine when the host is growing exponentially

components.data: During your 3rd growth curve when exponential growth is occuring, fix 1 ml of cells with 5 µl 25% glutaraldehyde.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: During your 3rd growth curve when exponential growth is occuring, fix 1 ml of cells with 5 µl 25% glutaraldehyde.

components.data:
Determine the length of time to sample during the one-step experiement. Below, you will find already published phage growth parameters, which can help you determine the length to sample for your one-step experiment

Phage(s) Morphology Burst Size Latent Period Host Citation
Syn5 podovirus 20-30 1 hr WH8109 Raytcheva et al. (2010)
S-CBP1, S-CBP2, S-CBP3 podovirus 75-92     Wang (2007)
P60 podovirus 81 1 hr WH7803 Brown et al (2006)
P-SSP7 podovirus   8 hrs Med4 Lindell et al (2007)
S-PM2* myovirus 21 9 hrs WH7803 Wilson et al (1996)
S-CAM4 myovirus ~50   WH7803 Kuznetsov et al (2010)
S-TIM5 myovirus ~35 6 hrs WH8102 Sabehi et al (2012)
S-CBM2 myovirus 28   CB0101 Wang (2007)
S-RIM1 myovirus 63 6 hrs WH7803 Stoddard et al (2007)
S-RIM8 myovirus 86 8 hrs WH7803 Stoddard et al (2007)
S-CBS2, S-CBS3, S-CBS3 siphovirus 57-175 > podoviridae
latent periods		 CB0204, CB0202, CB0101 Wang (2007)
S-BB1 siphovirus 250 Synechococcus strain Mann (2003)
*under phosphate limitation burst size is reduced by 80% and latent period is increased (Wilson et al. 1996)

components.data: Pipette 1ml from the flask into a 1.5ml centrifuge tube using the same 1ml serological pipette.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pipette 1ml from the flask into a 1.5ml centrifuge tube using the same 1ml serological pipette.

components.data: Not filtered (Total Phage)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Not filtered (Total Phage)

components.data: Perform a serial dilution to dilute the sample to 10<sup>2</sup> per ml (10<sup>-3</sup>)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Perform a serial dilution to dilute the sample to 10<sup>2</sup> per ml (10<sup>-3</sup>)

components.data: Not filtered (Total Phage)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Not filtered (Total Phage)

components.data: Add 250µl of the 10<sup>-3</sup> dilution and 250µl of the 10<sup>-2</sup> dilution to the corresponding 15ml snap cap tube with 1ml host.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 250µl of the 10<sup>-3</sup> dilution and 250µl of the 10<sup>-2</sup> dilution to the corresponding 15ml snap cap tube with 1ml host.

components.data: Not filtered (Total Phage)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Not filtered (Total Phage)

components.data: Allow phage and host to incubate for 2 hours and then plate using 4ml SN top agar per plate.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Allow phage and host to incubate for 2 hours and then plate using 4ml SN top agar per plate.

components.data: Not filtered (Total Phage)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Not filtered (Total Phage)

components.data: Continue sampling in this way for 16 hours (and sample one more time at 24 hrs).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Continue sampling in this way for 16 hours (and sample one more time at 24 hrs).

components.data: Part III: One Step Growth Experiment
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Part III: One Step Growth Experiment

components.data: At later time points more dilutions will need to be plated. Be generous with what you plate (i.e., plate 10<sup>-2</sup>, 10<sup>-3</sup>, 10<sup>-4</sup>, 10<sup>-5</sup>).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: At later time points more dilutions will need to be plated. Be generous with what you plate (i.e., plate 10<sup>-2</sup>, 10<sup>-3</sup>, 10<sup>-4</sup>, 10<sup>-5</sup>).

components.data: Count again on day 14 and 21.

components.data: Part III: One Step Growth Experiment
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Part III: One Step Growth Experiment

components.data: Calculate PFU/ml at each time point for both the centrifuged (free phage only) and not centrifuged (total phage) samples. Graph the results.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Calculate PFU/ml at each time point for both the centrifuged (free phage only) and not centrifuged (total phage) samples. Graph the results.

components.data: Part III: One Step Growth Experiment
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Part III: One Step Growth Experiment

components.data: Calculate burst size. Take the FREE phage average of the time points on the plateau before the burst (A).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Calculate burst size. Take the FREE phage average of the time points on the plateau before the burst (A).

components.data: Part III: One Step Growth Experiment
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Part III: One Step Growth Experiment

components.data: Take the FREE phage average of the time points on the plateau after the burst (B).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Take the FREE phage average of the time points on the plateau after the burst (B).

components.data: Part III: One Step Growth Experiment
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Part III: One Step Growth Experiment

components.data: Subtract A and B. This the total burst or new phages released (C).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Subtract A and B. This the total burst or new phages released (C).

components.data: Part III: One Step Growth Experiment
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Part III: One Step Growth Experiment

components.data: Divide C by the number of infecting phage (TOTAL phages at T0 minus FREE at T0). This is the burst size.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Divide C by the number of infecting phage (TOTAL phages at T0 minus FREE at T0). This is the burst size.
